result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah J Roberto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fines to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month or penalty of 10 days Huber for non-payment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leah J Roberto in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Ehrfurth makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.
 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count 1    
FINE:  $505.00

The Court Orders the Following:  Count 2
FINE:  $505.00

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing  8/15/2016.  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 10 days in Huber
Sentencing hearing on August 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Leah J Roberto in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed.  Formal reading waived.  Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.  Court schedules sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
